data.title: Robert Shaw Movies List, Ranked
data.meta_description: Over 200 filmgoers have voted on the 30+ films on Robert Shaw Movies List, Ranked. Current Top 3: Jaws, The Sting, A Man for All Seasons
data.text:
Ranked By

1.5K votes

299 voters

Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

The realm of Robert Shaw films is an enchanting universe filled with powerful performances, compelling storytelling, and a timeless charm that has captivated audiences for decades. As a respected and versatile actor, Shaw left a mark on cinema, bringing depth and nuance to an array of diverse characters throughout his career. Each film delivers a different perspective on Shaw's extraordinary talent, making it a true challenge to determine which of his on-screen embodiments stand out the most.

This collection of exceptional Shaw films highlights not only the actor's incredible range but also the quality of the movies themselves. From thrilling adventures to historical dramas, these fine films showcase Shaw's commitment to his craft, resulting in breathtaking performances that remain etched in cinematic history. Whether playing a shark hunter in Jaws or a notorious con artist in The Sting, Shaw consistently offered top-notch performances, proving his status as one of the all-time greats.

It's impossible to discuss the best Shaw movies without notable mentions of Jaws, The Sting, and A Man for All Seasons. In Jaws, Shaw delivers an unforgettable performance as the fearless shark hunter Quint, while The Sting showcases his cunning charisma as the suave criminal mastermind Doyle Lonnegan. In A Man for All Seasons, Shaw dons the royal mantle as King Henry VIII, demonstrating his acting prowess in a visually stunning historical drama. Each of these cinematic gems offers a distinct glimpse into Shaw's versatility, solidifying the enduring legacy of his illustrious career.

After delving into the wide-ranging selection of Shaw movies, it becomes abundantly clear that he was a once-in-a-generation talent whose impact on the big screen cannot be overstated. This curated compilation of his finest films serves as a testament to Shaw's artistic genius, offering viewers a window into the heart and soul of an acting legend. Prepare yourself to be transported into the enthralling world of Robert Shaw's cinematic masterpieces, where every movie is a celebration of his extraordinary contribution to the world of film.

1

Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw, Richard Dreyfuss

Released : 1975

Directed by : Steven Spielberg

In the classic thriller Jaws, the quiet summer resort of Amity Island is thrown into chaos by a deadly great white shark. Police Chief Martin Brody (Roy Scheider) must team up with oceanographer Matt Hooper (Richard Dreyfuss) and grizzled shark hunter Quint (Robert Shaw) to stop it. Directed by Steven Spielberg, this film redefined the horror genre, creating the concept of a summer blockbuster. The film's tension-filled plot and iconic score won it three Academy Awards, including Best Original Score for John Williams. Despite its simple premise, Jaws remains an enduring masterpiece of suspense and fear.

2

Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Robert Shaw

Released : 1973

Directed by : George Roy Hill

Following the murder of a mutual friend, aspiring con man Johnny Hooker (Robert Redford) teams up with old pro Henry Gondorff (Paul Newman) to take revenge on the ruthless crime boss responsible, Doyle Lonnegan (Robert Shaw). Hooker and Gondorff set about implementing an elaborate scheme, one so crafty that Lonnegan won't even know he's been swindled. As their big con unfolds, however, things don't go according to plan, requiring some last-minute improvisation by the undaunted duo.

3

Released : 1966

Directed by : Fred Zinnemann

When the highly respected British statesman Sir Thomas More (Paul Scofield) refuses to pressure the Pope into annulling the marriage of King Henry VIII (Robert Shaw) and his Spanish-born wife, More's clashes with the monarch increase in intensity. A devout Catholic, More stands by his religious principles and moves to leave the royal court. Unfortunately, the King and his loyalists aren't appeased by this, and press forward with grave charges of treason, further testing More's resolve.

4

Henry Fonda, Robert Shaw, Robert Ryan

Released : 1965

Directed by : Ken Annakin

American Lt. Col. Dan Kiley (Henry Fonda), a military intelligence whiz, discovers that the Nazis are planning to attack Allied forces near Belgium. Certain that the exhausted enemy can't muster much force, Gen. Joe Grey (Robert Ryan) isn't convinced by Kiley's findings, and his men pay the price when the German tanks begin their offensive. In the heat of this key World War II battle, Kiley must come up with a plan when it becomes clear that the Nazis are trying to steal fuel from the Allies.

5

Jacqueline Bisset, Nick Nolte, Robert Shaw

Released : 1977

Directed by : Peter Yates

Undersea adventure about a couple who become involved in a dangerous conflict with treasure hunters when they discover a deadly shipwreck in Bermudan waters. When they realize that the cache includes morphine, the pair enlist the help of an old treasure hunter to escape the drug dealers who hid their product amidst the sunken wreck.

Released : 1974

Directed by : Joseph Sargent

In New York City, a criminal gang led by the ruthless "Mr. Blue" (Robert Shaw) hijacks a subway car and threatens to start shooting one passenger per minute unless they receive a million dollars in cash from the city within an hour. On the other end of the line, crusty veteran transit policeman Zachary Garber (Walter Matthau) has his hands full dealing with the mayor's office and his hotheaded fellow cops, while also trying to deliver the ransom before the deadline expires.
